result.execSummary:
The defendant Mardi T. Suggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA Sample.  If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mardi T. Suggs in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Mardi T. Suggs in custody from Jackson Correctional.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states their recommendations.  Atty Ruby has a discrepancy w/what he thinks DE plead to.  Clerk provides copy of plea/questionaire to Atty Ruby.  State notes third CSR provided to DE.  Court will not include enhancer on Ct 3.  State continues recs.  Atty Ruby makes his recommendations.  State responds.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court sentences.  Court reads WEDS form to parties.  DE advised of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 2:
Ct 3:  w/o enhancer***

Ct 2:  8 years prison (3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentence

Ct 3: 4 years prison (2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision) concurrent to Ct 2

Conditions of extended supervision:
Costs of $518.00 x 2 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision through the clerk of court's office
DE is eligible for ERP/CIP/SAP
DNA samples to be provided
Jackson Correctional
Sentencing hearing on December 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mardi T. Suggs in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Mardi T. Suggs in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State agrees to cap the recommendations to 8 year prison, 4 in, 4 out.  Parties agree to waive PSI.  Atty Ruby enters NC pleas to counts 2 & 3.  DE agrees.  Court questions on pleas, accepts and finds guilty.  

Count 2:  NC

Count 3:  NC

Counts 1, 4 & 5:  Dismissed but read in
